synsets.definition: The quality of being mentally sharp and ready to notice or respond to potential threats or changes in the environment
Systematic observation and supervision of an area or situation to maintain security and detect problems
Japanese martial arts concept of remaining mentally alert and physically ready even after completing an action
Sufi practice of maintaining conscious awareness and spiritual watchfulness while in meditation
Sanskrit term for the state of being awake and consciously aware of one's surroundings
French concept of maintaining watch or guard, especially during nighttime hours
African philosophical concept of community-based alertness where individuals remain aware for the benefit of the group
Military observation of a region to locate an enemy or ascertain strategic features
Arabic term for maintaining guard or protective surveillance over something valuable
Buddhist-derived practice of maintaining moment-to-moment awareness of thoughts, feelings, and surroundings
To explore an area to gather information about conditions or potential threats
German concept of being wakeful and alert to potential dangers or important developments
A person who keeps watch for danger or unauthorized entry
Traditional indigenous skill of maintaining heightened awareness of natural environment and potential threats
Islamic concept of thoughtful contemplation and awareness of divine signs and worldly conditions
Having the ability to notice things carefully and be aware of changes or potential threats
Spanish term for regularly walking or traveling around an area to monitor for security or problems
Traditional Australian Aboriginal skill of reading environmental signs to track movement and assess safety
Japanese concept of wordless communication and awareness between people in potentially dangerous situations
Italian/Spanish concept of maintaining protective vigilance over people, places, or valuable items
Perception of elements in the environment and comprehension of their meaning in relation to safety
Hindu concept of maintaining focused awareness during meditation while remaining alert to surroundings
Portuguese/Spanish term for making regular security rounds to check for problems or threats
Careful consideration of circumstances and potential consequences before acting
Traditional Native American practice of maintaining awareness while traveling through potentially dangerous territory
Paying close attention and being mindful of potential dangers or important details
Traditional Japanese practice of maintaining heightened sensory awareness while remaining undetected
Latin-derived term for staying awake and alert, especially during times when sleep would be normal
Arabic concept of combining wisdom and awareness to assess situations with both knowledge and caution
Afrikaans concept of looking ahead and being prepared for future challenges or threats
Systematic examination of the outer boundaries of an area to ensure security and detect intrusions
Hindu concept of being aware of mental impressions and habitual patterns that might affect perception of threats
Irish traditional practice of community members taking turns to watch for threats to the village
Spanish military term for identifying and evaluating potential threats or strategic positions
Chinese practice of being aware of environmental energies and arrangements that might affect safety and well-being
A remote guard position established to provide early warning of approaching threats
Japanese martial concept of maintaining constant readiness and awareness befitting a warrior
Careful judgment that allows someone to avoid danger or unwise actions
Arabic term for one who watches or observes, often with connotations of spiritual or moral oversight
Māori concept of maintaining awareness that honors ancestral wisdom and protects the community
System or practice of detecting and reporting potential threats before they become immediate dangers
Characterized by deep thought and careful consideration of one's surroundings and situation
Methodically examining an area or situation to detect changes or potential threats
Indigenous practice of applying accumulated wisdom and experience to assess and prepare for potential threats
Having a duty to deal with or take care of something, including maintaining appropriate vigilance
Sufi concept of maintaining heart-centered awareness and presence in all situations
Organized effort by local residents to monitor their area for suspicious activity and maintain security
Chinese martial art principle of maintaining calm awareness and readiness while in fluid motion
Showing careful attention and persistent effort in watching, monitoring, or examining for potential issues
African concept of individuals who maintain vigilance not just for themselves but for the wellbeing of their entire community
